variants.Description in input context: G2019S mutation in the LRRK2 gene

Material used.Description: The kinase activity of LRRK2 variants was assessed using recombinant LRRK2 protein expressed in E. coli.

Readout description.Result Description: The G2019S variant showed a 2.3-fold increase in kinase activity compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis of kinase activity measurements.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 1.5-fold of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 2-fold of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with plasmids expressing wild-type or mutant LRRK2.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing the G2019S variant showed increased phosphorylation of the substrate Rab10 compared to wild-type controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used for comparing phosphorylation levels between wild-type and mutant groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels within 1.5-fold of wild-type controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels exceeding 2-fold of wild-type controls.
